Ladies and gentlemen, the response "did you know that she had to walk backward to avoid having her photo taken" is an excellent example of an engaging response. 

Firstly, it is relevant to the previous topic of discussion, namely Taylor Swift. This response not only shows the speaker's knowledge of Taylor Swift's behavior but also adds an interesting fact to the conversation. 

Secondly, this response is surprising and unexpected. It is not common knowledge that Taylor Swift walks backwards to avoid the paparazzi, and this fact is likely to pique the interest of the other person in the conversation. 

Lastly, this response is concise and to the point. It does not drag on or become convoluted, which can cause the listener to lose interest. 

In conclusion, the response "did you know that she had to walk backward to avoid having her photo taken" is engaging because it is relevant, surprising, and concise. I rest my case.

topic_chat_history:
school shootings are so upsetting . 
 it is an unspeakable act 
 when kids have to question the president about why was a killer able to terrorize their school 
 it would be a challenge to answer . did you know that the only us president with a phd degree was woodrow wilson 
 i did nt know that . the u.s president 's guest house is larger than the white house 
 that is a very surprising fact . also , the last president to speak a foreign language fluently was fdr 
 the wealthiest presidents are jfk , washington , jefferson . i thought trump would be lol 
 that surprised me too . where did they get their money from 
 inheritance probably . at least their name is not banana like the first president of zimbabwe 
 1 
 yah and the president of indonesia has released 3 pop albums while in office 
 is it real ? by the way , are you a fan of taylor swift 
 i was until i knew she removed her music from spotify because " music should not be free "
